  • AZAM BAKI: MACC INSTRUMENTAL IN HELPING GOVT RECOVER RM28.93B OF 1MDB FUNDS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/03/08/azam-baki-macc-instrumental-in-helping-govt-recover-rm2893b-of-1mdb-funds/58490

    03/08/2023, 10:07

    45.45% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, March 8 — Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) chief commissioner Tan Sri Azam Baki said that the agency had so far recovered RM28.93 billion and assets siphoned through the 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) scandal

    “This is a national victory for Malaysia and we were one of the agencies involved in the 1MDB task force, apart from the Attorney-General’s Chambers, the Finance Ministry and the National Anti-Financial Crime Centre,” he was quoted as saying

    Azam was speaking to the press after signing a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Universiti Teknologi Mara (UiTM) and Malaysia Institute of Accountants (MIA) at the MACC headquarters yesterday

    Azam pointed out that MACC and UiTM had been in discussion since last year, mainly on sharing the expertise from its Accounting Faculty

    “With this MoU, it is hoped that we can realise cooperation between UiTM and MACC in terms of negotiation services, development of training modules, anti-corruption awareness and education programmes as well,” he reportedly said

    He also hoped to further strengthen the UiTM governance and integrity agenda.

    ['anti', 'corruption', 'macc', 'azam', 'say']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, March 8 — Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) chief commissioner Tan Sri Azam Baki said that the agency had so far recovered RM28.93 billion and assets siphoned through the 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) scandal

    “This is a national victory for Malaysia and we were one of the agencies involved in the 1MDB task force, apart from the Attorney-General’s Chambers, the Finance Ministry and the National Anti-Financial Crime Centre,” he was quoted as saying

    Azam was speaking to the press after signing a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Universiti Teknologi Mara (UiTM) and Malaysia Institute of Accountants (MIA) at the MACC headquarters yesterday

    Azam pointed out that MACC and UiTM had been in discussion since last year, mainly on sharing the expertise from its Accounting Faculty

    “With this MoU, it is hoped that we can realise cooperation between UiTM and MACC in terms of negotiation services, development of training modules, anti-corruption awareness and education programmes as well,” he reportedly said

    He also hoped to further strengthen the UiTM governance and integrity agenda.

  • US SET TO LIFT COVID-19 TESTING REQUIREMENTS FOR TRAVELLERS FROM CHINA: SOURCE

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/world/us-set-lift-covid-19-testing-requirements-travellers-china-3332801

    03/08/2023, 09:13

    64.71% Shortened!

    Last week, Japan dropped a requirement that everyone take a test for the virus upon arrival from China

    The source told Reuters the United States would continue to monitor cases in China and around the world

    The United States in early January joined India, Canada, Italy, Japan and other countries in taking new measures after Beijing's decision to lift stringent zero-COVID policies

    It required new air passengers, two years and older to get a negative result from a test no more than two days before departure from China, Hong Kong or Macao

    China was battered with a surge in COVID-19 cases after it abruptly abandoned its zero-COVID policy in early December, unleashing the virus on its 1.4 billion population

    The source told Reuters on Tuesday the CDC would keep that program, known as the Traveler-based Genomic Surveillance Program (TGS), which asks travellers to volunteer to help with early detection of new variants.

    ['world', 'new', 'reuters', 'covid', 'china']

    It required new air passengers, two years and older to get a negative result from a test no more than two days before departure from China, Hong Kong or Macao

    “When a motion is brought to the general assembly, it is the highest body in Umno, so when the motion was brought by the party’s permanent chairman, it is in accordance with the party constitution,” he said

    Saifuddin had said that Umno is exempted from complying with Section 13(1)(c)(iv) of the Societies Act 1966 for its internal party election this month

    Meanwhile, in his speech, Zahid also urged party members to vote for leaders who had the party’s best interests at heart, and who could further Umno’s agenda

    However, immigration counters are beyond the jurisdiction of the Transport Ministry and MAHB

    On the suspension of aerotrains that connect KLIA’s satellite building with the main building, Loke said MAHB will ensure seamless transition of all passengers

    On March 3, MAHB said that it would suspend its aerotrain operations at KLIA until further notice

    The decision was made following a train that had halted mid-way on the tracks from KLIA’s main terminal building to the satellite building on March 1

    I just visited Penang airport last week

    ['airport', 'say', 'passenger', 'mahb', 'satellite']

  • SAIFUDDIN CONFIRMS UMNO WAS GIVEN EXEMPTION

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/03/08/saifuddin-confirms-umno-was-given-exemption

    03/08/2023, 08:07

    64.71% Shortened!

    “In reference to Umno’s constitution and meeting rules, the ministry has decided to grant an exemption from compliance of Section 13(1)(c)(iv) through Section 70 of Act 832 regarding the decision of the additional motion approved at the assembly held in January that the president and deputy president posts will not be contested in the upcoming Umno elections,” he said in the statement

    Under Section 70 of the Act, the minister may at his discretion in writing exempt any society registered under the Act from all or any of the provisions of said Act

    On Saturday, Ahmad Zahid, at an Umno event in Penang, said the party had received a letter from the ministry confirming that ROS – which is under the Home Ministry’s purview – had accepted the party’s no-contest resolution for the top two posts

    Before that, Umno vice-president Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob had asked Ahmad Zahid to produce the ROS letter following the controversy over the additional motion passed at the party’s 2022 general assembly in January

    Later yesterday, Umno secretary-general Datuk Seri Ahmad Maslan reiterated that the motion for no contests for Umno’s president and deputy president posts did not violate the party’s constitution

    His post came following a viral letter dated March 2 purportedly by ROS addressed to Umno saying that the party’s no-contest motion for the two posts was invalid.

    ['umno', 'act', 'post', 'president', 'party']

    “In reference to Umno’s constitution and meeting rules, the ministry has decided to grant an exemption from compliance of Section 13(1)(c)(iv) through Section 70 of Act 832 regarding the decision of the additional motion approved at the assembly held in January that the president and deputy president posts will not be contested in the upcoming Umno elections,” he said in the statement

    Under Section 70 of the Act, the minister may at his discretion in writing exempt any society registered under the Act from all or any of the provisions of said Act

    On Saturday, Ahmad Zahid, at an Umno event in Penang, said the party had received a letter from the ministry confirming that ROS – which is under the Home Ministry’s purview – had accepted the party’s no-contest resolution for the top two posts

  • S'PORE SOFTWARE ENGINEER SALARIES HIT RECORD HIGH

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2023/03/08/spore-software-engineer-salaries-hit-record-high

    03/08/2023, 08:07

    79.31% Shortened!

    The unprecedented demand for highly skilled tech professionals is driving up salaries to record highs

    Competition for tech talent drove up salaries in the sector in Singapore last year, though the rise of artificial intelligence (AI) may reshape the types of skills in demand

    In 2022, salaries of software engineers in Singapore surged 7.6% to an all-time high, according to an annual tech salary report released on Tuesday

    “As companies across various industries increasingly rely on technology to drive growth, the value of tech talent has never been higher.” But the “jaw-dropping salary offers” thrown at tech workers in previous years are likely to taper off, said NodeFlair

    He expects a rise in demand for workers in customer experience management, customer behaviour analysis and change management

    Machine learning and data modelling experience will be most in demand

    ['demand', 'tech', 'salary', 'singapore', 'engineer']

  • 'ISLAMIC BODIES SHOULD BE APOLITICAL'

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/03/08/islamic-bodies-should-be-apolitical

    03/08/2023, 08:07

    70.0% Shortened!

    Sultan Sharafuddin also thanked Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim on behalf of the Council of Malay Rulers for appointing a non-politician as Minister of Religious Affairs in the Prime Minister’s Department

    The Sultan said it would ensure the principle of separation of powers, with respect to the administration of Islam between the executive and the Malay Rulers, in accordance with the constitutional monarchy system in place in the country

    The Sultan also expressed hope that the council meeting yesterday would be a watershed moment to return the role of administering Islam to those who were worthy

    “I am confident that with this new beginning, the Council of Malay Rulers – as the voice of the Rulers in Malaysia – can play their necessary roles to develop Islam’s administration at the federal level and to foster closer ties with the states,” the Sultan said

    “I urge all parties to support efforts to strengthen Islam and the council, and to place the administration of Islamic institutions at the federal level on the right track

    The Sultan also advised all council members to respect the views of states and preserve good relations so as to ensure that the administration of Islam in the country would progress smoothly

    ['sultan', 'administration', 'say', 'council', 'islam']

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/business/cathay-pacific-posts-wider-us834-million-loss-2022-upbeat-outlook-3333251

    03/08/2023

    57.14% Shortened!

    In January, the airline forecast a loss of between HK$6.4 billion and HK$7 billion for the 12 months ended Dec 31 after facing tough rules related to the COVID-19 pandemic during the period

    Analysts had expected an average annual loss of HK$4.4 billion, according to Refinitiv data

    They forecast a HK$3.9 billion profit for this year now that Hong Kong and mainland China have ended border restrictions

    "After three brutal years of the COVID-19 pandemic, we have finally entered into a new exciting phase in which we will rebuild Cathay Pacific for Hong Kong," Lam added

    Cathay was badly hit by COVID-related flight cancellations, border closures and strict quarantine measures for crew during the pandemic, resulting in drastic headcount reductions

    Cathay said that it was operating about one-third of pre-pandemic passenger flight capacity by December and ended the year operating passenger flights to 58 destinations, double the 29 destinations the airline flew to in January 2022.

    Rivian (RIVN) shares are sliding today as the EV-maker announces plans for a “green” debt offering

    In line with Rivian’s ethos as a company (it’s a Climate Pledge signatory and was the first to say it won’t use deep-sea mining for batteries), it intends to use the capital it raises for “green” or environmental purposes

    In its most recent earnings report, Rivian barely reached its production goal for the year but reported an adjusted EBITDA loss of $5.22 billion

    Rivian reported it had cash on hand of $12.01 billion at the end of the fourth quarter and expects capital expenditures to reach $2 billion for the year

    Rivian says production of that vehicle will start in 2026

    With a long lead time until its next vehicle, Rivian’s cash situation is a key focus for analysts and investors

  • BIDEN’S ONE-SIZE-FITS-ALL PLAN TO PROTECT RENTERS COMES 'AT THE EXPENSE' OF MOM-AND-POP LANDLORDS — WHAT TO DO IF YOU STILL WANT A SLICE OF THE REAL ESTATE PIE

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/biden-one-size-fits-plan-150000623.html

    86.96% Shortened!

    Many rely on rent money to pay their mortgages, property taxes and other maintenance fees — but this income stream was threatened during the pandemic when the federal government temporarily banned evictions for non-payment of rent

    The average national rent-to-income ratio is now 30% and it hasn't been that high for more than 20 years, according to the latest data from Moody's Analytics

    For comparison, the average rent-to-income ratio in 1999 — the year Moody's started tracking this metric — was 22.5%

    “The rent-to-income ratio continued to climb up because income growth was not able to catch up with the rent growth,” Lu Chen, a senior economist at Moody’s Analytics, told the New York Times

    They collect rent from tenants and pass that rent to shareholders in the form of regular dividend payments

    Its stock performance was up 18.8% year-over-year (YoY) on Jan

    ['renter', 'landlord', 'rent', 'property', 'income']

    Liverpool handed United the joint-heaviest competitive defeat in its history on Sunday, and its largest since another 7-0 reverse on Boxing Day 1931, with the messages now adding to the embarrassment

  • CHINA’S GRAND PLAN FOR A WORLD-BEATING DIGITAL FUTURE

    https://asiatimes.com/2023/03/chinas-grand-plan-for-a-world-beating-digital-future/

    03/08/2023

    81.82% Shortened!

    Although the new body is known as the National Data Bureau, its mandate will not be limited to the management of data flow in China

    It will also take up some of the State Council’s responsibilities, such as the planning of China’s Big Data strategy and digital infrastructure

    He said the collection and categorization of data will create new demand for China’s Big Data, AI and cloud companies and data center operators, as well as chip and IT equipment makers. Yang Chang, chief analyst at Zhongtai Securities Co, said data is a key production factor after land, labor, capital and technology while its strategic value is increasing

    Yang said the National Data Bureau will encourage state-owned and private companies to use their data to create commercial value

    In October 2021, former Chongqing mayor Huang Qifan said companies should pay a “data tax” if they traded any of their users’ data

    He said the central government could set up a center to manage all local data activities and allow several key cities to set up data transaction bourses

    ['new', 'digital', 'china', 'technology', 'data']

    Although the new body is known as the National Data Bureau, its mandate will not be limited to the management of data flow in China

    It will also take up some of the State Council’s responsibilities, such as the planning of China’s Big Data strategy and digital infrastructure

    He said the collection and categorization of data will create new demand for China’s Big Data, AI and cloud companies and data center operators, as well as chip and IT equipment makers. Yang Chang, chief analyst at Zhongtai Securities Co, said data is a key production factor after land, labor, capital and technology while its strategic value is increasing

    Yang said the National Data Bureau will encourage state-owned and private companies to use their data to create commercial value

    In October 2021, former Chongqing mayor Huang Qifan said companies should pay a “data tax” if they traded any of their users’ data

    He said the central government could set up a center to manage all local data activities and allow several key cities to set up data transaction bourses

    ['new', 'digital', 'china', 'technology', 'data']

    “Whether or not I’m sued, it’s not an issue because I want the government to solve this issue,” said Dr Wee

    “If the prices of corn can be reduced, chicken and egg prices will recover

    We want everyone to feel good and that’s what we are hoping for in Malaysia,” added Mohamad

    Dr Wee had previously warned that the government would face a barrage of criticisms if the chicken egg shortage was not solved as Ramadan and Hari Raya Aidilfitri drew near

    Mohamad had previously said that the government is providing a 10 sen subsidy for each egg until June.

  • I'M 50. HOW MUCH SHOULD I HAVE IN MY 401(K)?

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/much-401-k-50-183150668.html

    90.91% Shortened!

    Consider working with a financial advisor as you flesh out your retirement plan

    What Your Retirement Savings Should Look Like by Age 50 Financial experts sometimes suggest planning for your retirement income to be about 80% of your pre-retirement income

    In that case, you would want about $2 million in your retirement fund

    So someone who earns $100,000 per year will want to have around $1.5 million in their retirement fund by age 65

    You can put as much money into it as you like then just plan on leaving it there for retirement

    Tips on Retirement Planning We can all use help with our finances, and never more so than when it’s time to save for retirement

  • POWELL TELLS CONGRESS RATES WILL LIKELY BE 'HIGHER THAN PREVIOUSLY ANTICIPATED'

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/powell-tells-congress-rates-will-likely-be-higher-than-previously-anticipated-150011657.html

    68.42% Shortened!

    Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell told lawmakers on Tuesday interest rates are likely to rise more than previously expected as the central bank works to bring down inflation, which remains stubbornly above the central bank's 2% target

    The Fed projected at its December policy meeting interest rates would need to rise to a range of 5%-5.25% this year, though Powell's comments now suggest rates will need to eventually rise above this level

    Following the Fed's February policy decision, the central bank's benchmark interest rate stands in a range of 4.5%-4.75%

    The Fed chair said Tuesday policymakers will continue to make decisions on a meeting by meeting basis, and while Powell acknowledged the FOMC has slowed its pace of rate hikes he did not mention whether or not rate hikes would continue at that pace

    Powell noted that economic data from January on inflation, job growth, consumer spending, and manufacturing production have partly reversed course from the slowdown seen back in December

    He reiterated the Fed still needs to see a drop in services inflation excluding housing to bring inflation down, which is likely to require a weaker job market

    ['powell', 'interest', 'rate', 'inflation', 'fed']

    Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell told lawmakers on Tuesday interest rates are likely to rise more than previously expected as the central bank works to bring down inflation, which remains stubbornly above the central bank's 2% target

    The Fed projected at its December policy meeting interest rates would need to rise to a range of 5%-5.25% this year, though Powell's comments now suggest rates will need to eventually rise above this level

    Following the Fed's February policy decision, the central bank's benchmark interest rate stands in a range of 4.5%-4.75%

    The Fed chair said Tuesday policymakers will continue to make decisions on a meeting by meeting basis, and while Powell acknowledged the FOMC has slowed its pace of rate hikes he did not mention whether or not rate hikes would continue at that pace

    Powell noted that economic data from January on inflation, job growth, consumer spending, and manufacturing production have partly reversed course from the slowdown seen back in December

    He reiterated the Fed still needs to see a drop in services inflation excluding housing to bring inflation down, which is likely to require a weaker job market

    ['powell', 'interest', 'rate', 'inflation', 'fed']

  • SEEKING 9% DIVIDEND YIELD? HERE ARE 2 DIVIDEND STOCKS GEORGE SOROS IS HOLDING FOR INCOME GROWTH

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/seeking-9-dividend-yield-2-150138142.html

    88.0% Shortened!

    OneMain Holdings (OMF) The first ‘Soros pick’ we’ll look at is OneMain, a consumer finance company with a difference

    In the last declaration, the common share payment was bumped up by 5.3% to an even $1 per share

    The annualized rate of $4 gives the dividend a yield of 9.2%

    Based on the current dividend yield and the expected price appreciation, the stock has ~26% potential total return profile

    Revenue came in at $20.5 billion, for a 10% year-over-year gain, while the operating income rose from $1.7 billion to $1.8 billion

    The shares are priced at $13.05 and the $16.57 average price target suggests a one-year gain of 27% from that level

    ['year', 'soros', 'stock', 'dividend', 'yield']

  • MILLENNIALS ARE SINKING UNDER THE WEIGHT OF THEIR DEBTS, ADDING A RECORD $3.8 TRILLION TO THE PILE LAST QUARTER. HERE’S WHAT’S DRIVING THAT — PLUS 3 TIPS TO GET YOUR HEAD ABOVE WATER

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/millennials-sinking-under-weight-debts-130000850.html

    72.73% Shortened!

    Their demographic alone amassed nearly $4 trillion in debt in the fourth quarter of 2022, according to the Wall Street Journal's analysis of Federal Reserve Bank of New York data

    Millennials in their 30s have added over $3.8 trillion in debt to their accounts — and are missing their credit card and auto loan payments at startling rates as well, according to the New York Fed

    Across all age groups in the survey, mortgage debt makes up the biggest share of outstanding balances — with that number rising by nearly $1 trillion last year, according to the New York Fed

    When you don’t pay your credit card bill on time, you risk harming your credit score and adding up on interest and late fees — exacerbating your existing debt and making it more difficult to pay off

    Aside from drivers in their 20s, this age group is also missing the most auto loan payments, says the New York Fed

    With a strong credit score, you could land a rate of between 6% to 8%

    ['debt', 'new', 'york', 'rate', 'credit']

    The challenge for Liverpool, though, is that it probably won't be able to afford the World Cup star this summer if it lands its top target in Bellingham

    Equally, though, it may be reluctant to wait until 2024, when Gvardiol's release clause becomes active

    In that sense, Gvardiol may be the right player — perhaps even the perfect player — just at the wrong time.

    03/08/2023

    50.0% Shortened!

    Welcome to the ESPN Singapore Edition Frank Leboeuf explains why Kai Havertz's composure impressed him vs

    However, another VAR review found several Dortmund players had encroached into the penalty area before Havertz had struck the ball, prompting Makkelle to order a retake, which the Germany international converted to send his team into the quarterfinals by a 2-1 aggregate score

    "I'm not sure what more he can do with his hand," Bellingham said after the match of the initial handball call

    I don't see any other way to look at it

    It's how you react to the bad times, get some perspective and analyse it in the correct way

    Things are never bad forever, but it felt like that sometimes! "My job is to help the team, help the players, prepare the team as well as we could and to support them

    https://paultan.org/2023/03/08/lamborghini-lb744-early-details/

    03/08/2023

    78.57% Shortened!

    The specific output of 128 PS per litre is also the highest in the history of the company’s 12-cylinder engines

    This electric motor also doubles as the starter motor and generator, the latter applicable for regenerative braking to charge the lithium-ion battery

    These form part of the electric all-wheel drive system and they also provide a torque vectoring function

    When in electric mode, the LB744 is front-wheel drive only to optimise energy consumption, while electric drive to the rear axle is activated on demand when needed

    The front electric motors also act as the reverse gear and can be helped along by the rear electric motor if more momentum is required

    Don’t expect a lot of electric-only range though, as the battery only has an energy capacity of 3.8 kWh

    ['lamborghini', 'march', 'also', 'electric', 'motor']

  • IRAN ARRESTS SCHOOL POISONING SUSPECTS AS CASES TOP 5,000

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/world/2023/03/08/iran-arrests-school-poisoning-suspects-as-cases-top-5000/58504

    03/08/2023

    73.91% Shortened!

    The interior ministry said in a statement on Tuesday “a number of people” suspected of manufacturing hazardous substances had been arrested in six provinces, including a pupil’s parent

    Iran’s deputy interior minister, Majid Mirahmadi, told state television earlier on Tuesday that the “intelligence agencies” had made several arrests, “and the relevant agencies are conducting a full investigation”

    ‘Fear and despair’ President Ebrahim Raisi tasked the interior and intelligence ministries last week with providing continuous updates on the poisoning cases, dubbing them “the enemy’s conspiracy to create fear and despair” among the people

    “In less than five per cent of the students transferred to hospital, irritant materials were found which led to their ill-health,” the interior ministry said on Monday

    The latest case — reported by the ISNA news agency — involved 40 pupils, all of them female, in the restive southeastern city of Zahedan on Tuesday

    The first cases were reported in Iran’s Shiite clerical capital of Qom in late November, a month after the Amini protests that later spread to universities and schools

    ['arrest', 'poisoning', 'pupil', 'late', 'monday']

  • RAFIZI DEFENDS PM ANWAR FOR HOLDING FINANCE PORTFOLIO

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/03/08/rafizi-defends-pm-anwar-for-holding-finance-portfolio

    03/08/2023

    60.0% Shortened!

    This after several Perikatan Nasional MPs slammed Rafizi for allegedly going against his previous stand that a prime minister should not be holding the finance portfolio, and to the extent of filing a private member's bill to oppose such a move

    Rafizi however said that good governance was not just whether the prime minister was holding the finance portfolio, but there was actually a whole system that needed to be looked at

    "What needs to be looked at is what are the steps that have been taken which shows the leanings of the prime minister," Rafizi said in his winding up speech for his ministry on the Budget 2023 debates in Parliament on Wednesday (March 8)

    Datuk Dr Radzi Jidin (PN-Putrajaya) and Mohd Syahir Che Sulaiman (PN-Bachok) pointed out that Rafizi had used to criticise such a practice, especially during former prime minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak’s administration

    Rafizi said it was different under Anwar, as there was no interference with enforcement bodies, which was already different from Najib’s tenure as prime minister

    He also pointed out that the prime minister had cancelled all projects awarded under direct negotiation and re-tendered them for open tender

    ['minister', 'rafizi', 'prime', 'anwar', 'finance']

  • SAIFUDDIN NASUTION SAYS AUTHORITIES NEGLIGENT IN CASE OF FAMILY GIVEN WRONG BODY TO CREMATE

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/03/08/saifuddin-nasution-says-authorities-negligent-in-case-of-family-given-wrong-body-to-cremate/58616

    03/08/2023

    53.85% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, March 8 — Home Minister Senator Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail said authorities were negligent in the case of an Indian family that was told their son had died in prison and given another person’s body they nearly cremated

    The minister told Parliament that a special task force would investigate the matter in which the Prison Department called the family, as they were preparing for the cremation, that their son was alive and well

    “I admit there was an element of negligence and weakness in the system

    Yesterday, it was reported that a Tampin family was shocked to learn that son was alive as they were preparing to cremate what they thought was his body

    The father was told by the Prisons Department that his son had died in Sungai Buloh Prison last Thursday, New Straits Times reported

    The 45-year-old found out that his son, who he believed was living in Selayang, was remanded at the Sungai Buloh Prison on February 28 for an undisclosed offence.

    ['minister', 'say', 'family', 'told', 'son']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, March 8 — Home Minister Senator Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail said authorities were negligent in the case of an Indian family that was told their son had died in prison and given another person’s body they nearly cremated

    The minister told Parliament that a special task force would investigate the matter in which the Prison Department called the family, as they were preparing for the cremation, that their son was alive and well

    Domestic Trade and Cost of Living Minister Datuk Seri Salahuddin Ayub said the initiative by the leading fast food restaurant proved that Menu Rahmah was not a low-class menu only for the B40 group, as claimed by some quarters

    "I am confident that this company will not compromise in ensuring that the food is of good quality," he said after launching the menu here today (March 8)

    Meanwhile, McDonald's Malaysia vice-president and chief marketing officer Melati Abdul Hai said the restaurant offers three options for the menu, namely chicken burger, chicken porridge and McEgg, each with a cup of iced lemon tea

    "We are happy to be able to support and provide the Rahmah Menu to help ease the burden of the people in dealing with the rising cost of living

    In conjunction with the launch of the budget-friendly menu, McDonald's announced its special Ramadan menu, namely the Chicken Foldover and Meat Foldover, which will be available at all McDonald's outlets from today

    At the event today, McDonald's treated orphans from Pertubuhan Kebajikan Islam Peribadi Mulia in Kajang

    McDonald's is also having a 30-Day Ramadan promotion where customers can enjoy various promotions and attractive rewards through the McDonald's application during the fasting month

    03/07/2023, 22:07

    60.0% Shortened!

    Tuesday, 07 Mar 2023

    Addressing over 100 diplomatic officers here on Tuesday (March 7), Anwar appeared unperturbed by PAS president Tan Sri Abdul Hadi Awang's claims of toppling the current government

    Abdul Hadi reportedly said that no parties would be able to stop Perikatan Nasional's plans to topple the government, saying that politics is dynamic and that such practice is considered normal in a democratic country

    At the session, Anwar said in order to bring the country to its past glory, Malaysians, including government officers, must not only uphold good governance but must be ready to make changes

    We must do this and affect this change, which is extremely necessary to save this country from the mess that we have been in

    Anwar called on the heads of diplomatic missions to do better for the country, and it was vital for Malaysian officers and diplomats overseas to set an example of what it meant to be a good competent leader

    ['anwar', 'say', 'government', 'hadi', 'topple']

  • TWO STRONG EARTHQUAKES ROCK SOUTHERN PHILIPPINES

    https://www.thesundaily.my/world/two-strong-earthquakes-rock-southern-philippines-CE10720615

    03/07/2023, 21:09

    64.71% Shortened!

    But a shallower second quake, measuring 5.6 magnitude, hit nearly three hours later in the neighbouring municipality of New Bataan, triggering the collapse of some houses

    About 100 people inside a shopping mall in Tagum city, in the adjacent province of Davao del Norte, were hit by falling glasses and plates as they fled the building, said Jay Suaybaguio, the provincial information officer

    “I was in the third floor buying office supplies when the quake suddenly struck,“ Suaybaguio told AFP

    “We are still outside because a moderate aftershock just hit.” While the quake did not appear to have destroyed anything, Clemen said, it was strong enough to “cause fear”

    The last major quake was in the northern Philippines in October

    A 7.0-magnitude quake in mountainous Abra last July triggered landslides and ground fissures, killing 11 people and injuring several hundred

    ['earthquake', 'say', 'building', 'magnitude', 'quake']

    https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2023/03/07/property-listing-shows-abby-chois-luxury-flat-that-may-have-caused-her-death-sold-for-rm415mil

    03/07/2023, 21:08

    76.0% Shortened!

    Abby Choi had bought the house under her ex-father-in-law's name

    On Monday, the mother of Ms Choi filed a writ to forbid her daughter’s former father-in-law, Kwong Kau, from selling the 1,820 sq ft luxury flat that Ms Choi allegedly bought under his name

    Kwong, a former police officer, as well as his sons Anthony Kwong, 31, and Alex Kwong, 28, who was Ms Choi’s ex-husband, were charged with Ms Choi’s murder on Feb 27

    Seven people have been linked to Ms Choi’s death so far

    The four-bedroom apartment was reportedly bought for at least HK$70 million (S$12 million) in 2019, according to local media

    While the sales contract for the apartment was reportedly signed by Kwong, making him the legal owner of the property, it was Ms Choi who bought the unit and made the full payment as at October 2019

    ['apartment', 'million', 'sell', 'choi', 'kong']

  • BRAIN DRAIN: MAJORITY OF MSIANS WHO MIGRATED MOVED TO SINGAPORE, SAYS HR MINISTER

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/03/07/brain-drain-majority-of-those-who-migrated-moved-in-singapore-says-hr-minister

    03/07/2023, 21:08

    57.14% Shortened!

    He said questions were raised on how to retain and pull talent back into Malaysia

    "The issue of brain drain is a norm happening everywhere in the world

    But if we were to compare globally, some 3.6% of the world's population have migrated from their home country to other countries

    "From the Malaysian perspective, the migration percentage is only 5.6% from the total population (33 million)

    "So, to say it is a brain drain or migration, they have only gone to our neighbouring country Singapore," he said after chairing the dialogue session attended by 20 industry captains from the private sector

    The industry captains are members of TalentCorp Industry-Talent Advisory Council and TalentCorp Malaysia Global Talent Advisory Group (MyLead)

    ['say', 'malaysia', 'brain', 'drain', 'industry']

    Her lawyer Datuk Akberdin Abdul Kader told the court that Syamsul, 38, had hit Puteri Sarah in the year 2020

    According to Puteri Sarah's lawyer, it was this violent incident that forced her to move out of the house

    Akberdin said the allegation that plaintiff Puteri Sarah was disobedient to the command of her husband (nusyuz) made by Syamsul was baseless

    On Jan 6, Syamsul announced that he had married Ira Kazar in Thailand and that Ira is his second wife, while Puteri Sarah is his first wife

    Puteri Sarah and Syamsul were married on March 8, 2014 and have two children, Shaikul Islam, six, and Sumayyah, four

    ['syamsul', 'puteri', 'sarah', 'divorce', 'court']

  • QUICKCHECK: WILL A THIRD WAVE OF FLOODS IN JOHOR BE CAUSED BY OVERFLOWING DAMS?

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/true-or-not/2023/03/07/quickcheck-will-a-third-wave-of-floods-in-johor-be-caused-by-overflowing-dams

    03/07/2023, 18:08

    45.45% Shortened!

    WITH the flooding currently ongoing in Johor, many are naturally worried that the situation will worsen, and as such, any social media messages claiming to have such news would likely go viral

    Recently, a claim was made online that a third wave of flooding in Johor will be caused by dams releasing water to prevent instabilities

    “The release of water from the dams is being done according to standard operating procedures and no water is being pumped out using large pumps as claimed in the viral recording,” it said

    The department said that the public could refer to the publicinfobanjir.water.gov.my website for the latest information on the floods.

    Irrigation and Drainage Department

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    “The release of water from the dams is being done according to standard operating procedures and no water is being pumped out using large pumps as claimed in the viral recording,” it said

  • FRENCH BAILIFFS ATTEMPT TO SEIZE THREE PARIS PROPERTIES OWNED BY MALAYSIA IN SULU SULTANATE LEGAL DISPUTE

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/03/07/french-bailiffs-attempt-to-seize-three-paris-properties-owned-by-malaysia-in-sulu-sultanate-legal-dispute

    03/07/2023, 18:08

    75.0% Shortened!

    The Filipino heirs of the last sultan of Sulu are seeking to enforce a US$14.9bil award granted to them by a French arbitration court last year, amid a long-running dispute with the Malaysian Government over a colonial-era land deal

    Malaysia, which did not participate in the arbitration, maintains the process was illegal and has obtained a stay on the ruling in France

    The French judge further found that the properties, located in the 16th arrondissement (administrative district) near the Malaysian embassy in Paris, did not qualify as diplomatic premises, according to the court documents

    The Malaysian Government and the French court, the Tribunal Judiciaire de Paris, did not immediately respond to requests for comment

    On Feb 17, PETRONAS said in a statement that claims by the purported Sulu heirs on two of its subsidiaries in Luxembourg were baseless and it would continue to defend its position from a legal aspect

    Kuala Lumpur stopped the payments after a bloody incursion in 2013 by supporters of the former sultanate who wanted to reclaim land from Malaysia

    ['french', 'malaysian', 'sultanate', 'malaysia', 'heir']

  • PERTH MINT SAYS NO QUESTION ABOUT PURITY OF GOLD BARS SOLD TO CHINA

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/business/perth-mint-gold-bars-sold-china-no-question-about-purity-3330856

    03/07/2023

    53.85% Shortened!

    A variety of gold bars stamped with the Perth Mint logo

    The report said that the mint may have to recall a potential A$9 billion worth of 1kg diluted gold bars sold to China

    The mint said, in September 2021, it was made aware that some of its 1kg bars may not have met the non-gold specifications of the Shanghai Gold Exchange (SGE) - referring to the amount of components such as silver that make up 0.01 per cent of each gold bar, or 100 parts per million (ppm)

    As per the SGE specifications, the non-gold component should contain no more than 50 ppm silver, it said

    It had also implemented new processes to ensure that the gold bars adhere to the SGE's "non-gold specification standards", the refiner said

    The Perth Mint, owned by the government of Western Australia, is the world's largest producer of newly mined gold.

    ['gold', 'bar', 'perth', 'mint', 'say']

    A variety of gold bars stamped with the Perth Mint logo

    The report said that the mint may have to recall a potential A$9 billion worth of 1kg diluted gold bars sold to China

    The mint said, in September 2021, it was made aware that some of its 1kg bars may not have met the non-gold specifications of the Shanghai Gold Exchange (SGE) - referring to the amount of components such as silver that make up 0.01 per cent of each gold bar, or 100 parts per million (ppm)

    As per the SGE specifications, the non-gold component should contain no more than 50 ppm silver, it said

    It had also implemented new processes to ensure that the gold bars adhere to the SGE's "non-gold specification standards", the refiner said

    The Perth Mint, owned by the government of Western Australia, is the world's largest producer of newly mined gold.

    ['gold', 'bar', 'perth', 'mint', 'say']

    It added that Audi Singapore is working with the authorities to identify the cause of the explosion

  • TAIWAN FEB EXPORTS FALL AGAIN; H1 OUTLOOK POOR

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/business/taiwan-feb-exports-fall-again-h1-outlook-poor-3330961

    03/07/2023, 17:07

    66.67% Shortened!

    The data improved from a 21.2 per cent annual drop seen in January, but lagged a Reuters poll forecast for a 14 per cent contraction

    Taiwan's total shipments of electronics components in February fell 17.8 per cent from a year before to US$12.94 billion, with semiconductor exports down 17.3 per cent

    Smaller rival United Microelectronics reported on Monday that its February sales had sunk 18.6 per cent from a year before

    At US$11.0 billion in February, Taiwan's exports to China, the island's largest trading partner, were down 30.2 per cent, after showing a 33.5 per cent annual drop in the previous month

    February's exports to the United States slipped 13.7 per cent, after falling an annual 14.5 per cent in the prior month

    That compared with economists' forecast of a 9.8 per cent fall and a 16.6 per cent decline in January.

    ['export', 'february', 'month', 'low', 'year']

    The data improved from a 21.2 per cent annual drop seen in January, but lagged a Reuters poll forecast for a 14 per cent contraction

    Smaller rival United Microelectronics reported on Monday that its February sales had sunk 18.6 per cent from a year before

    At US$11.0 billion in February, Taiwan's exports to China, the island's largest trading partner, were down 30.2 per cent, after showing a 33.5 per cent annual drop in the previous month

    That compared with economists' forecast of a 9.8 per cent fall and a 16.6 per cent decline in January.

    62.5% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Mar 7 — Datuk Seri Najib Razak told the sessions court here today that former federal territories deputy minister Edmund Santhara Kumar should not have travelled to New Zealand when Malaysia was under a movement control order (MCO)

    Prabakaran — said it was “morally wrong” for Edmund to take a 55-day trip abroad when others in Malaysia could not cross its borders

    In his lawsuit, Santhara claim that during a press conference on March 17, 2021, Prabakaran made allegedly false statements about the former’s trip to New Zealand in 2020

    During cross-examination, Santhara’s lawyer, N Krishnan, then reportedly put forth to Najib that Santhara’s trip to New Zealand was not unlawful as it was approved by the then prime minister, Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin

    Najib replied that the trip should not have been approved in the first place

    In March 2021, Edmund stated that he left for his 55-day trip to New Zealand on December 23, 2020, in order to take a break and be with his family after not missing a day of work for a year, and partially because his wife was ill

  • $9 BILLION AUSSIE GOLD BAR SCANDAL ERUPTS

    https://www.news.com.au/entertainment/tv/current-affairs/perth-mint-9-billion-australian-gold-bar-purity-scandal/news-story/5335809fb284dba96957c56b68ea8ac9

    03/07/2023

    89.09% Shortened!

    ‘Doping’ gold The Perth Mint is the world’s biggest processor of new gold and is the only mint globally with a government guarantee

    In 2018, the Perth Mint began “doping” its new gold

    In 2021, the Shanghai Gold Exchange (SGE), a key buyer of Perth produced gold, told the Mint a number of the bars it had received contained too much silver and not enough gold

    The Mint estimated that if it had to recall all 100 tons of gold it had shipped to Shanghai it could be on the nose for $8.7 billion

    Lack of oversight of bullion buyers The Mint has also come under scrutiny for who it sells gold too

    Kremlin link Perth Mint also had a relationship with the Bank of Cyprus

    ['gold', 'bar', 'mint', 'perth', 'bank']

    ‘Doping’ gold The Perth Mint is the world’s biggest processor of new gold and is the only mint globally with a government guarantee

    In 2018, the Perth Mint began “doping” its new gold

    In 2021, the Shanghai Gold Exchange (SGE), a key buyer of Perth produced gold, told the Mint a number of the bars it had received contained too much silver and not enough gold

    The Mint estimated that if it had to recall all 100 tons of gold it had shipped to Shanghai it could be on the nose for $8.7 billion

    Lack of oversight of bullion buyers The Mint has also come under scrutiny for who it sells gold too

    Kremlin link Perth Mint also had a relationship with the Bank of Cyprus

  • BOSSES CRY FOUL OVER BOOSTER JABS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/03/07/bosses-cry-foul-over-booster-jabs

    03/07/2023

    72.73% Shortened!

    “Plans to make booster jabs compulsory for foreign workers just because of the overstocking of Sinovac vaccines are very irresponsible,” he said in a statement yesterday

    On Saturday, its chief executive officer was reported to have raised the possibility of the vaccines being used as booster shots for foreign workers

    Health Minister Dr Zaliha Mustafa had said last month that the government is looking at making it compulsory for foreign workers to get booster shots

    “But employers must not be forced or charged any extra cost when implementing any rules pertaining to vaccination or booster shots for foreign workers,” he said

    Currently, foreign workers are required to undergo a medical check-up in their home country and be declared medically fit before entering Malaysia

    Within a month of arrival, they have to undergo a medical check-up by the Foreign Workers Medical Examination Monitoring Agency and will be sent back if they fail it.

    ['employer', 'booster', 'foreign', 'worker', 'say']

    “And not to mention, the unity government already has a two-thirds majority in Parliament

    With this being the scenario, stop sleep-talking about toppling this government

    Is the current government so bad that it needs to be replaced?” he asked

    Mohammad Agus, who was appointed to his current position by Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim last month, was responding to a statement by Hadi last week where the latter announced a prediction that the current government would collapse soon

    Hadi did not specify a reason for the collapse

    ['hadi', 'current', 'government', 'mohammad', 'agus']

  • KIM'S POWERFUL SISTER THREATENS ACTION ON US-SOUTH KOREA DRILLS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2023/03/07/kims-powerful-sister-threatens-action-on-us-south-korea-drills

    03/07/2023

    66.67% Shortened!

    Kim Yo-jong (pic) said North Korea is monitoring the "restless military moves by the US forces” and its South Korean "puppet military,” adding Pyongyang is "on standby to take appropriate, quick and overwhelming action at any time according to our judgment,” the official Korean Central News Agency reported Tuesday (March 7)

    The latest comments indicate North Korea could ramp up provocations in conjunction with the drills, with Kim last month threatening to turn the Pacific Ocean into a "firing range” if they went ahead

    The US and South Korea are set to hold their Freedom Shield exercises from March 13-23, drills designed to bolster their defenses against North Korea’s nuclear and missile threats

    The last time North Korea launched a missile into the Pacific was October 2022, when it fired a Hwasong-12 intermediate-range ballistic missile over Japan, flying about of 4,600km (2,860 miles), and marking the longest distance traveled by a North Korean missile to date

    The drills had been scaled down or halted under former President Donald Trump, who was hoping the move would facilitate his nuclear negotiations with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un

    North Korea for decades has called the joint exercises a prelude to an invasion and nuclear war

    ['north', 'korea', 'south', 'drill', 'kim']

  • MARKET PARTICIPANTS MUST BE PREPARED TO CAPITALISE ON PRICE VOLATILITY - BURSA MALAYSIA

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2023/03/07/market-participants-must-be-prepared-to-capitalise-on-price-volatility---bursa-malaysia

    03/07/2023, 15:07

    68.42% Shortened!

    "As the global hub for palm oil price discovery, Bursa Malaysia Derivatives remains steadfast in developing a sustainable marketplace by improving our ecosystem and enhancing our products as reliable hedging instruments against price volatility,” he said in his opening remarks at the Palm and Lauric Oils Conference and Exhibition (POC2023) here today

    POC2023, which ends tomorrow, is organised by Bursa Malaysia

    Citing an example, Abdul Wahid said Bursa Malaysia recently launched the Alternative Delivery Procedure (ADP) in September 2022 for its main contracts, namely crude palm oil futures (FCPO), East Malaysia crude palm oil futures (FEPO), and crude palm kernel oil futures (FPKO)

    On the outlook of the industry, Abdul Wahid said the Malaysian palm oil industry is expected to maintain its robust standing and demonstrate strong growth despite the ongoing global economic uncertainty and recession fears in 2023

    "In tandem with this projection, the Malaysian Palm Oil Board anticipates that exports of Malaysian palm oil to increase by 3.7 per cent to 16.30 million tonnes in 2023, up from 15.72 million tonnes in 2022, owing primarily to continued demand from importing countries,” said Abdul Wahid

    "This has sparked a response from the Council of Palm Oil Exporting Countries (CPOPC), led by Malaysia and Indonesia, with the possibility of stopping exports to Europe," he noted

    ['price', 'bursa', 'malaysia', 'abdul', 'wahid']

    "As the global hub for palm oil price discovery, Bursa Malaysia Derivatives remains steadfast in developing a sustainable marketplace by improving our ecosystem and enhancing our products as reliable hedging instruments against price volatility,” he said in his opening remarks at the Palm and Lauric Oils Conference and Exhibition (POC2023) here today

    POC2023, which ends tomorrow, is organised by Bursa Malaysia

    Citing an example, Abdul Wahid said Bursa Malaysia recently launched the Alternative Delivery Procedure (ADP) in September 2022 for its main contracts, namely crude palm oil futures (FCPO), East Malaysia crude palm oil futures (FEPO), and crude palm kernel oil futures (FPKO)

    On the outlook of the industry, Abdul Wahid said the Malaysian palm oil industry is expected to maintain its robust standing and demonstrate strong growth despite the ongoing global economic uncertainty and recession fears in 2023

    "In tandem with this projection, the Malaysian Palm Oil Board anticipates that exports of Malaysian palm oil to increase by 3.7 per cent to 16.30 million tonnes in 2023, up from 15.72 million tonnes in 2022, owing primarily to continued demand from importing countries,” said Abdul Wahid

    "This has sparked a response from the Council of Palm Oil Exporting Countries (CPOPC), led by Malaysia and Indonesia, with the possibility of stopping exports to Europe," he noted

    “I put him in the trial today to see how he’d get through that, and now it’s all how he pulls up in the next day

    It’s not what I’d want to do, but there’s only one Derby and that’s what owners buy these horses for

    I’ll assess things in the next 24 hours, but it’s going to be a tough ask to go straight to a Derby.” While the Derby field will be revealed by the Jockey Club on Thursday, it was confirmed on Monday that Hong Kong Mile champion California Spangle will have five rivals in what will be a bumper Group One Queen’s Silver Jubilee Cup (1,400m) on March 19 – the same day as the Derby

    Lee announced his resignation at the height of his political career in March 1983, relinquishing his presidency

    Wisma MCA, which houses the party headquarters now, was one of the major projects during Lee’s presidency

    Separately, the number of victims at flood evacuation centres in Malaysia has dropped slightly to 42,501 people as of Tuesday afternoon, down from 43,406 the night before, according to the National Disaster Management Agency (NADMA)

    The 24-year-old woman was found in her car in Johor’s Mersing district and was feared to have drowned, Malay Mail reported

    Johor remains the worst-hit state with 39,315 people evacuated to the flood relief centres, down from 40,129 people from the night before

    According to NADMA, 212 flood relief centres remain open in the state

    Batu Pahat is the worst affected district in Johor, with 23,370 people evacuated to 78 flood relief centres

    The eastern Ukrainian city has been badly damaged during the longest and bloodiest battle since Russia's more than year-long invasion

    Outside Bakhmut, some Ukrainian soldiers had lost hope that Kyiv would hold the city and looked set to retreat

    The Ukrainian army said on Sunday that its troops had fought off "more than 130" Russian attacks in a single day around Bakhmut and said Moscow's forces were trying to encircle the city

    About 4,500 civilians remain in Bakhmut, Ukrainian officials have said

    South of Bakhmut, Russia's Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu visited Mariupol, the port city that Moscow captured after a long siege last Spring

    Ahmad Zahid, who is the Rural and Regional Development Minister, said the works will be funded by his ministry

    “It has to be done before Christmas or December 25 not just because of the celebrations but also due to the monsoon season (around that period),” he said after chairing the Rural and Regional Development Ministry’s (KKDW) Coordination Meeting with the Sarawak government at Wisma Bapa Malaysia here today

    Jiwa Murni road projects were previously undertaken by the Defence Ministry to provide connectivity to rural and interior areas

    “Especially for the Jiwa Murni roads, the logging roads and also the rural road projects that are already in the pipeline that have to be implemented

    Ahmad Zahid also said the repair of Jiwa Murni and logging roads were among 10 points that were agreed during the coordination meeting, which was the first to be held this year

    “We are determined that the implementation of what we have agreed will be monitored by the technical authority represented by the KKDW and also the state government through two or ministries

    73.91% Shortened!

    "In this matter, I have told the Sarawak Premier that such matters will be coordinated with the state government due to its close proximity to ensure it will be more beneficial,” said Anwar

    Anwar said the participation of the companies will make Sabah and Sarawak a strategic site in the Brunei Darussalam–Indonesia–Malaysia–Philippines East Asean Growth Area (BIMP-EAGA) initiative

    He then said that such projects – especially those involving gas – will likely be led by the Sarawak government as it is geographically closer to Nusantara

    For us, including Sarawak, it is also an attractive investment," Anwar added

    "With various other new initiatives by the Sarawak state government, I am confident that it will be a catalyst for more growth for the (BIMP-EAGA) area, God-willing," said the Prime Minister

    To the initial question, Anwar said the Federal Government will closely coordinate all development for the project with the Sabah and Sarawak government, adding that Deputy Prime Minister II Datuk Seri Fadillah Yusof will be the main coordinator

    ['company', 'nusantara', 'say', 'anwar', 'government']

  • SALARIES OF SOFTWARE ENGINEERS IN SINGAPORE HIT RECORD HIGH; DEMAND FOR AI SKILLS TO RISE IN TECH SECTOR

    https://www.thestar.com.my/tech/tech-news/2023/03/07/salaries-of-software-engineers-in-singapore-hit-record-high-demand-for-ai-skills-to-rise-in-tech-sector

    03/07/2023, 13:07

    82.35% Shortened!

    Tech jobs that saw significant pay bumps in Singapore last year include mobile engineers, blockchain engineers and data engineers

    Competition for tech talent drove up salaries in the sector in Singapore last year, though the rise of artificial intelligence (AI) may reshape the types of skills in demand

    In 2022, salaries of software engineers in Singapore surged 7.6% to an all-time high, according to an annual tech salary report released on Tuesday

    Median base salaries were S$5,000 (RM16,621) for junior engineers, S$8,000 (RM26,593) for senior engineers and S$13,750 (RM45,705) for engineering managers, according to the report by tech talent platform NodeFlair and technology accelerator Iterative

    Other tech jobs that saw significant pay bumps in Singapore in 2022 include mobile engineers, blockchain engineers and data engineers

    According to the report, the median salary of Singapore software managers was almost seven times that of their peers in India which, in contrast, had more than double the proportion of higher-ranked “lead” managers than Singapore

    ['tech', 'singapore', 'engineer', 'talent', 'salary']

    Tech jobs that saw significant pay bumps in Singapore last year include mobile engineers, blockchain engineers and data engineers

    Competition for tech talent drove up salaries in the sector in Singapore last year, though the rise of artificial intelligence (AI) may reshape the types of skills in demand

    In 2022, salaries of software engineers in Singapore surged 7.6% to an all-time high, according to an annual tech salary report released on Tuesday

    Median base salaries were S$5,000 (RM16,621) for junior engineers, S$8,000 (RM26,593) for senior engineers and S$13,750 (RM45,705) for engineering managers, according to the report by tech talent platform NodeFlair and technology accelerator Iterative

    Other tech jobs that saw significant pay bumps in Singapore in 2022 include mobile engineers, blockchain engineers and data engineers

    According to the report, the median salary of Singapore software managers was almost seven times that of their peers in India which, in contrast, had more than double the proportion of higher-ranked “lead” managers than Singapore

    ['tech', 'singapore', 'engineer', 'talent', 'salary']

    This effectively means that Syamsul refuses to pronounce the talak (divorce proclamation) on Puteri Sarah

  • PM ANWAR: FUNDS FOR PN APPROVED FLOOD MITIGATION PROJECTS HALTED DUE TO HIGH COST, DIRECT NEGOTIATIONS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/03/07/pm-anwar-funds-for-pn-approved-flood-mitigation-projects-halted-due-to-high-cost-direct-negotiations/58371

    03/07/2023, 13:07

    72.73% Shortened!

    His response came after Perikatan Nasional’s (PN) Arau MP Datuk Seri Shahidan Kassim asked about plans to call for a state of emergency in Johor due to the flood crisis

    Anwar said the flood mitigation projects have instead been expedited, but by limited tender process

    “So we used the limited tender method but expedited the project, that’s all

    “(I) didn’t cancel the flood mitigation projects, (I) cancelled the direct negotiations,” he said

    The federal government’s flood mitigation project 2030 had been announced by previous finance minister Datuk Seri Tengku Zafrul Abdul Aziz in October during the tabling of Budget 2023 as part of Malaysia’s long-term strategy to deal with climate change

    He added that the Johor State Government had put in place preparations for the flood, and this has contributed to managing the flood situation in the state well and helped save many lives.

    ['anwar', 'say', 'flood', 'mitigation', 'project']

  • AFTER US$15 BIL AWARD, 'HEIRS' OF THE FORMER SULU SULTAN TARGET MALAYSIAN PROPERTIES IN PARIS

    https://www.theedgemarkets.com/node/658074

    03/07/2023, 13:07

    77.78% Shortened!

    The bailiffs tried to assess the properties on Monday (March 6), following a court-issued seizure order in December, but Malaysian officials at the Paris embassy turned them away, the lawyers and the Malaysian government said

    The seizure attempt in Paris has not been reported previously

    The Malaysian law ministry did not respond to a request for comment on the preliminary award

    A Malaysian law ministry spokesperson said the bailiffs appeared at the Malaysian embassy in Paris but were turned away

    They declined to comment further. Malaysia’s foreign ministry and its embassy in Paris declined to comment

    The Malaysian government,  and the French court — the Tribunal Judiciaire de Paris, did not immediately respond to requests for comment

  • MANCHESTER UNITED MADE THREE TACTICAL ERRORS IN LIVERPOOL FC THRASHING

    https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-liverpool-tactics-highlights-26397073

    03/07/2023, 12:07

    66.67% Shortened!

    Erik ten Hag can't ignore the mistakes he made as Man Utd were thrashed by Liverpool at Anfield

    Sign up for our daily newsletter to get the day's biggest stories sent direct to your inbox We have more newsletters Manchester United's performance against Liverpool was so bad that much of the reaction has actually glossed over their own shortfalls in the match

    It is understandable why the United manager stuck with a similar tactical set-up that had seen his side defeat both Man City and Barcelona at home already this year, but it was naive to expect the same outcome when playing away from home

    In those wins over City and Barcelona they were always within touching distance of a comeback, but as soon as Liverpool scored again right after the break, United appeared to lose all hope of a way back into the game and soon imploded

    There is comfort in the fact that three of their next four matches are back at Old Trafford and can give them the springboard needed to get their season back on track, but to go to the next level they must stop making the same mistakes on the road

    United's rebuilding can't be limited to at home alone

    ['make', 'man', 'liverpool', 'get', 'united']

    In a statement, the group said Capital A president of commercial Colin Currie (pic) has also been appointed CEO of airasia Digital while John Cheing has been appointed chief financial officer of airasia Digital and airasia Super App, effective March 1

    "I have full confidence in Commercial President of Capital A, Colin Currie to take the CEO role for airasia Digital given his past experience of leading adidas to record-breaking growth in the regional market he managed

    "He will be heading a competent team to create stronger synergy and a better user experience in travel and payment by forging a closer collaboration between the airasia Super App and BigPay platforms for the users within the Capital A ecosystem," said Capital A CEO Tan Sri Tony Fernandes

    He added that Cheing's experience as the head of investments for Capital A and his close involvement especially with the strategic planning of airasia Super App will also be beneficial in his new role as the CFO for airasia Digital

    "Both Colin and John will work closely with me to scale our digital business portfolio up," said Fernandes.

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['capital', 'digital', 'airasia', 'super', 'app']

    The company intends to develop Malaysia as a cloud region for data storage

    https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/jurgen-klopps-midfield-decision-no-26401912

    03/07/2023, 11:07

    45.45% Shortened!

    A look at how Liverpool can line up when they travel to Bournemouth on Saturday lunchtime in the Premier League Follow the latest transfer news and more with our LFC newsletter We have more newsletters While Liverpool supporters will likely spend the rest of the season cherishing events at Anfield on Sunday, the focus has already turned for those on the inside

    The 7-0 hammering of Manchester United will echo for decades but Jurgen Klopp's focus has now moved to Saturday lunchtime's trip to Bournemouth as they look to continue their push for the top four

    In midfield, there are strong claims for Stefan Bajcetic to return to the side after his encouraging cameo off the bench on Sunday but it would seem harsh to drop out any of the three who started on Sunday, with Harvey Elliott, in particular, turning in one of his best performances as a Liverpool player

    Curtis Jones and James Milner came off the bench on Sunday but with the Reds engine room purring like never before this season, it would seem strange for Klopp to make any major changes for this trip to Gary O'Neil's side

    Roberto Firmino, who is entering the final months of his eight-year spell at Liverpool, did score from the bench against United, of course, but it seems likely that the Brazil international is likely to continue his role as deputy for now as the Reds head down south in a rich vein of form by this season's standards

    This could be, in all actuality, one of the easiest Klopp teams of the season

    03/07/2023, 11:07

    50.0% Shortened!

    Tuesday, 07 Mar 2023

    Speaking at the ministry’s monthly assembly here on Tuesday (March 7), Anwar, who is also Finance Minister, said staff of the ministry should carry out their tasks strictly including terms of procurement and distribution of allocation

    "The ministry needs to be feared because of its strict governance," he added

    Also present at the assembly were Deputy Finance Minister Datuk Seri Ahmad Maslan and Treasury secretary-general Datuk Johan Mahmood @ Johan Mahmood Merican

    "I hope the ministry can emerge as a strong ministry in terms of governance, intelligence and commitment,” he said

    Anwar said the ministry should be firm in carrying out its tasks in line with the government’s mission of fighting power abuse and corruption

  • MAN WHO ACCUSED MACC OF RM10M PLOT CHARGED WITH OBSTRUCTING INVESTIGATIONS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/03/07/man-who-accused-macc-of-rm10m-plot-charged-with-obstructing-investigations/58353

    03/07/2023, 11:07

    76.0% Shortened!

    The 32-year-old was charged under Section 48 of the MACC Act, which makes it an offence for any person who fails to comply with any lawful demand, notice, order or requirement of an MACC officer in the execution of the MACC officer’s duties

    The MACC officer’s order was issued under Section 30(1)(a), where an MACC officer investigating an offence under the MACC Act may order any person to appear before him to be examined orally in relation to any matter which the officer believes may assist the investigation

    Akram also verbally applied for the court to impose a “gag order” on Shafiq to stop him from issuing any statement or comments which would be “sub judice” towards this case and the trial that would take place, stressing that this gag order sought would be limited to just the charge

    But Chetan objected to the prosecution’s bid for a gag order on Shafiq, and said the prosecution should make a written application for the gag order to specify what it wanted to stop Shafiq from talking about

    The judge also ordered for Shafiq to hand over his passport to the court by tomorrow and said the passport will be kept by the court until the trial ends, and also ordered him to report to the nearest MACC office once a month until the end of the trial

    The MACC on February 21 rejected the allegations in the video as being defamatory

    ['shafiq', 'say', 'macc', 'order', 'officer']

  • FEARING CHATGPT IS ‘OPIUM,’ CHINA TO BUILD ITS OWN

    https://asiatimes.com/2023/03/fearing-chatgpt-is-opium-china-to-build-its-own/

    03/07/2023, 09:07

    80.65% Shortened!

    Wang’s calls came after state media said last month that ChatGPT might create national security risks to China

    China Daily said in a Weibo post on February 20 that the US government may use ChatGPT to spread disinformation in China and manipulate global narratives for its own geopolitical interests

    Chinese commentators say China should create its own chatbots as ChatGPT, which gives analysis based on English materials, is not suitable for the country. A Henan-based columnist in an article published on February 27 says that China has banned many influencers, or so-called “Big V” (verified social media users), for inappropriate speech but actually ChatGPT’s influence on the country has surpassed all these opinion leaders

    “Much evidence shows that ChatGPT is a political tool for the US to influence China,” says the writer

    Although it does not hard-sell American hegemony, it implants such a concept into its system and tries to stir up disputes in China.” He says ChatGPT tends to give negative comments about China, for example by concluding that China is the world’s largest greenhouse gas emitter without citing other reports that say the US is the biggest emitter

    The US also restricted sales of AMD’s MI250 Accelerator AI chip to China

    ['chinese', 'chatgpt', 'china', 'technology', 'say']

    https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-11829823/Liverpool-veteran-James-Milner-receives-MBE-honour-Windsor-Castle.html

    03/07/2023

    50.0% Shortened!

    Milner was presented with the honour by Prince William in the investiture ceremony on Tuesday, before sharing a laugh with one another

    The midfielder has spent two decades in the top flight and has won every domestic trophy there is to win at club level, including the Premier League title with both Manchester City and his current club Liverpool

    And Milner isn't the only footballer to be honour at Tuesday's special investiture ceremony

    Mike Summerbee, star of the Manchester City side of the 1960s and 70s, was made an OBE for services to football and to charity

    The 80-year-old, who made 357 league appearances for City, helped the club win the First Division in 1967-68 campaign before going on to secure the FA Cup, League Cup, Cup Winners' Cup and Charity Shield in the following years

    Mike Summerbee (right), star of the Man City side of the 1960s and 70s, is awarded his OBE Summerbee is a regular at City matches, home and away, in his role as a club ambassador He remains one of the most popular City figures after all of his many career achievements Summerbee remains one of City's most popular former players and still attends every City home and away game as an ambassador for the club

  • CNA EXPLAINS: WHAT IS THE UN HIGH SEAS TREATY AND HOW WILL IT PROTECT THE WORLD'S OCEANS?

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/sustainability/united-nations-treaty-high-seas-unclos-oceans-high-seas-3330971

    03/07/2023

    89.47% Shortened!

    The treaty is a legal framework that aims to protect ocean areas that exist outside national borders

    Because it is not owned, many parts of the ocean across the world are functionally lawless

    According to the United Nations Environment Programme, only 7.9 per cent of the global ocean is recognised as protected

    The marine biodiversity in the high seas is diverse and critical to food chains as well as the ocean ecosystem resilience

    This is especially so for areas in the Indian Ocean, the nearest ocean area that would fall under the treaty

    Chakrabongse gave the example of the Saya de Malha Bank, one of the largest submerged ocean banks in the world, located in the middle of the Indian Ocean

    ['treaty', 'ocean', 'area', 'sea', 'high']

    The treaty is a legal framework that aims to protect ocean areas that exist outside national borders

    Because it is not owned, many parts of the ocean across the world are functionally lawless

    According to the United Nations Environment Programme, only 7.9 per cent of the global ocean is recognised as protected

    The marine biodiversity in the high seas is diverse and critical to food chains as well as the ocean ecosystem resilience

    This is especially so for areas in the Indian Ocean, the nearest ocean area that would fall under the treaty

    Chakrabongse gave the example of the Saya de Malha Bank, one of the largest submerged ocean banks in the world, located in the middle of the Indian Ocean

    ['treaty', 'ocean', 'area', 'sea', 'high']



  • RIVIAN PLANS TO SELL $1.3 BILLION IN BONDS TO SHORE UP CAPITAL, SHARES FALL

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/rivian-plans-sell-1-3-002157295.html

    50.0% Shortened!

    SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - Rivian Automotive plans to sell bonds worth $1.3 billion, it said on Monday, as weakening demand and lofty costs tighten a cash crunch around electrical vehicle makers

    Shares in Rivian fell nearly 7% in after-hours trading

    The capital from this offering will help facilitate the launch of Rivian's smaller R2 vehicle family, a Rivian spokesperson told Reuters, adding that convertible debt was "optimal cost of capital versus selling equity at today's levels." Irvine, California-based Rivian, which makes R1T electric pickup trucks and R1S SUVs, has said its cash balance will fund its operations through 2025

    It reported cash and cash equivalents of $11.57 billion at the end of December, down from $13.27 billion a quarter earlier

    Late last year, it shelved plans to build delivery vans in Europe with Mercedes and had earlier pushed back by a year to 2026 the planned launch of a smaller R2 vehicle family at the $5 billion plant it is building in Georgia

    Rivian's bond will mature in March 2029 and investors will have the option to convert the bonds into cash or shares in the EV maker

    ['rivian', 'bond', 'billion', 'say', 'cash']

    SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - Rivian Automotive plans to sell bonds worth $1.3 billion, it said on Monday, as weakening demand and lofty costs tighten a cash crunch around electrical vehicle makers

    Shares in Rivian fell nearly 7% in after-hours trading

    The capital from this offering will help facilitate the launch of Rivian's smaller R2 vehicle family, a Rivian spokesperson told Reuters, adding that convertible debt was "optimal cost of capital versus selling equity at today's levels." Irvine, California-based Rivian, which makes R1T electric pickup trucks and R1S SUVs, has said its cash balance will fund its operations through 2025

    It reported cash and cash equivalents of $11.57 billion at the end of December, down from $13.27 billion a quarter earlier

    Late last year, it shelved plans to build delivery vans in Europe with Mercedes and had earlier pushed back by a year to 2026 the planned launch of a smaller R2 vehicle family at the $5 billion plant it is building in Georgia

    Rivian's bond will mature in March 2029 and investors will have the option to convert the bonds into cash or shares in the EV maker

    ['rivian', 'bond', 'billion', 'say', 'cash']



  • MAN WHO DECAPITATED, BUTCHERED HIS FATHER TO HANG AFTER FAILING APPEAL

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/03/07/appeal-fails-man-to-hang-for-killing-dad

    03/07/2023, 08:08

    71.43% Shortened!

    A three-member Court of Appeal bench, chaired by Justice Kamaludin Md Said, made a unanimous ruling after dismissing the appeal by You Poh Khoon, 57, to set aside the conviction and sentence on grounds of insanity

    “The court found the conviction and sentence by the High Court to be safe

    On May 24 last year, the Ipoh High Court sentenced Poh Khoon to death by hanging after he was found guilty of killing his father

    He said based on the psychiatric report, Poh Khoon tested positive for methamphetamine and amphetamine

    “The appellant at the time of the incident was sane and knew the nature and consequences because at the time of the incident, the appellant was able to drive a car for more than 100km and detail the incident and what he did to the deceased,” he added

    “All the witnesses were not experts who could determine the appellant’s mental state at the time of the incident and during the defence proceedings, no witness contradicted the psychiatrist’s testimony that the appellant was sane at the time of the incident,” he added

    ['sentence', 'poh', 'khoon', 'court', 'appellant']

    A three-member Court of Appeal bench, chaired by Justice Kamaludin Md Said, made a unanimous ruling after dismissing the appeal by You Poh Khoon, 57, to set aside the conviction and sentence on grounds of insanity

    “The court found the conviction and sentence by the High Court to be safe

    On May 24 last year, the Ipoh High Court sentenced Poh Khoon to death by hanging after he was found guilty of killing his father

    He said based on the psychiatric report, Poh Khoon tested positive for methamphetamine and amphetamine

    “The appellant at the time of the incident was sane and knew the nature and consequences because at the time of the incident, the appellant was able to drive a car for more than 100km and detail the incident and what he did to the deceased,” he added

    “All the witnesses were not experts who could determine the appellant’s mental state at the time of the incident and during the defence proceedings, no witness contradicted the psychiatrist’s testimony that the appellant was sane at the time of the incident,” he added

    ['sentence', 'poh', 'khoon', 'court', 'appellant']



  • BODY OF MISSING WOMAN FOUND IN MERSING, MAKING HER THE FIFTH CASUALTY IN JOHOR FLOODS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/03/07/body-of-missing-woman-found-in-mersing-making-her-the-fifth-casualty-in-johor-floods/58328

    03/07/2023, 08:08

    53.85% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise MERSING, March 6 — The body of a woman, who was earlier reported missing after her car was swept away by flood currents, was found inside her vehicle along Jalan Nitar Utama here late last night

    Mersing Fire and Rescue Station operations commander Assistant Fire Superintendent Abdul Muiz Mukhtar said the search-and-rescue team managed to free the victim’s body from the Perodua Myvi car at about 10.30 last night

    He said the Perodua Myvi car driven by the victim was believed to have veered off from the road near Jalan Nitar Utama here before being submerged in water at 6.45am yesterday

    “The operation to bring-up the victim's car that was submerged in flood waters started from 6.55pm, shortly after the Perodua Myvi was located about 15 metres from the last reported position

    In yesterday’s incident, the victim was believed to be driving along a flooded road from Mersing to Kluang before her Perodua Myvi was swept away by the flood’s currents at 6.45am

    The victim was believed to have been trapped inside her car as it submerged by flood waters.

    ['mersing', 'car', 'flood', 'last', 'say']
